title: Hugo Villaverde
text:
Hugo Eduardo Villaverde (born 27 January 1954 in <a href="Santa%20Fe%2C%20Argentina">Santa Fe</a>) is a retired <a href="Argentina">Argentine</a> <a href="Association%20football">football</a> defender who played most of his career for <a href="Club%20Atl%C3%A9tico%20Independiente">Club Atlético Independiente</a>. He holds the record in Argentina for most first division matches without scoring a goal, ahead of <a href="Jorge%20Titonell">Jorge Titonell</a> who in the 1930s and 40s played 405 matches for Talleres (Remedios de Escalada) and Huracán.
Villaverde started his professional playing career in 1973 with home town club <a href="Col%C3%B3n%20de%20Santa%20Fe">Colón de Santa Fe</a> at the age of 19.
In 1975, he joined Independiente where he became a key player throughout the 1970s and 1980s. He won four <a href="Argentine%20Primera">league</a> titles, the <a href="Copa%20Libertadores%201984">1984</a> <a href="Copa%20Libertadores">Copa Libertadores</a> and <a href="Copa%20Intercontinental">Copa Intercontinental</a> with the club.
Villaverde played for the <a href="Argentina%20national%20football%20team">Argentina national team</a> in 1979, but never returned to the international scene after suffering an injury in friendly match against <a href="Scotland%20national%20football%20team">Scotland</a>.
